parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. While the post encourages voting, it does not explicitly mention any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or party affiliation from the provided list.  The post uses inclusive language ("you") encouraging general participation.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The language used ("you," "your") is inclusive and aims for broad appeal.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Partially True. The primary objective seems to be encouraging voter turnout, not promoting a specific candidate. However, indirectly, increased voter turnout could benefit any candidate. The line between encouraging participation and influencing the vote is blurred here.  The post's timing (close to election day) is a significant factor.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. The post lacks the characteristics of journalistic reporting. It's a motivational message, not an objective news piece or analysis.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post is not expressing a personal opinion; it's a call to action related to the election.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>518887677800234</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post walks a fine line. While it doesn't explicitly endorse a specific candidate, its timing (close to election day) and the clear intention to boost voter turnout could be interpreted as indirectly influencing the election.  The lack of explicit candidate mention makes a definitive conclusion difficult.  However, the overall message and context suggest a potential violation, especially considering the paid nature of the Facebook post and its broad reach.  The "in dubio pro reo" principle should be applied cautiously here, as the potential for electoral influence is present.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Kovacs Mihály Levente</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Kovacs Mihály Levente, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024 (ID postare: 518887677800234), cu mesajul "Ha Magyari Albert 96 évesen is elmegy szavazni, akkor vasárnap neked is a szavazófülkében a helyed!", care, deși nu menționează explicit un candidat, are un efect electoral indirect prin încurajarea participării la vot, apropiindu-se de ziua alegerilor.  Mesajul, având în vedere contextul și plata pentru promovare, vizează o audiență largă și poate fi interpretat ca o tentativă de influențare a votului, chiar dacă nu nominalizează un candidat specific.  Chemarea la vot, în contextul apropiat de ziua alegerilor, constituie o formă de propagandă electorală, încălcând prevederile legale.  Postarea a generat între 10.000 și 15.000 de impresii, conform datelor din Ad Library, cu o cheltuială de sub 100 RON.  Datele de contact ale advertiserului sunt krisztakiss8@gmail.com și +40771707322.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
